facts: Contractor negligently left tools on a sidewalk
While falling, pedestrian grabbed a passerby
Passerby was startled and had a heart attack
Passerby had an unknown pre-existing heart condition
asp_facts: claim(c1). claim_type(c1, negligence). defendant(c1, contractor). plaintiff(c1, passerby). duty_owed(c1, yes). duty_breached(c1, yes). actual_cause(c1, yes). proximate_cause(c1, no). foreseeable_harm(c1, no). eggshell_plaintiff(c1, yes). damages(c1, 50000). injury_type(c1, physical).
question: Is the contractor liable to the passerby?
rationale: While the contractor breached a duty and there is actual causation, the heart attack to a passerby who was merely grabbed is not a foreseeable consequence of leaving tools on a sidewalk. Proximate cause requires foreseeability of the type of harm.
